intro: Deyeuxia capillaris, commonly known as narrowleaf bulrush, is a flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to saturated soil conditions. Deyeuxia capillaris plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
